June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
New	O
standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
not	O
yet	O
adopted	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
pronouncements	O
that	O
are	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
but	O
applicable	O
in	O
future	O
accounting	O
periods	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
:	O
Standard	O
Title	O
Summary	O
Effective	O
Date	O
AASB	O
9	O
Financial	O
Replaces	O
the	O
requirements	O
of	O
AASB	O
139	O
for	O
the	O
1/1/2018	O
Instruments	O
classification	O
and	O
measurements	O
of	O
financial	O
assets.	O
This	O
is	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
the	O
first	O
part	O
of	O
Phase	O
1	O
of	O
the	O
IASB	O
’	O
s	O
project	O
to	O
replace	O
IAS	O
39.	O
AASB	O
15	O
Revenue	O
The	O
AASB	O
has	O
issued	O
a	O
new	O
standard	O
for	O
the	O
1/1/2018	O
from	O
recognition	O
of	O
revenue.	O
This	O
will	O
replace	O
AASB	O
118	O
Contracts	O
which	O
covers	O
contracts	O
for	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
and	O
with	O
AASB111	O
which	O
covers	O
construction	O
contracts.	O
Customers	O
The	O
new	O
standard	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
principle	O
that	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
when	O
control	O
of	O
a	O
good	O
or	O
service	O
transfers	O
to	O
a	O
customer	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
notion	O
of	O
control	O
replaces	O
the	O
existing	O
notion	O
of	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards.	O
The	O
standard	O
permits	O
a	O
modified	O
retrospective	O
approach	O
for	O
the	O
adoption.	O
Under	O
this	O
approach	O
entities	O
will	O
recognise	O
any	O
applicable	O
transitional	O
adjustments	O
in	O
retained	O
earnings	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
application	O
(	O
i.e.	O
1	O
July	O
2017	O
)	O
without	O
restating	O
the	O
comparative	O
period.	O
Entities	O
will	O
only	O
need	O
to	O
apply	O
the	O
new	O
rules	O
to	O
contracts	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
completed	O
as	O
of	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
initial	O
application	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
elected	O
not	O
to	O
early	O
adopt	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
pronouncements.	O
These	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
have	O
significant	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
or	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
upon	O
adoption.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
Page	O
42	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Significant	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
include	O
:	O
-	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
The	O
future	O
recoverability	O
of	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
dependent	O
upon	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
factors	O
including	O
,	O
whether	O
the	O
Company	O
decides	O
to	O
exploit	O
the	O
related	O
lease	O
itself	O
or	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
whether	O
it	O
successfully	O
recovers	O
the	O
related	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset	O
through	O
sale.	O
Factors	O
that	O
could	O
impact	O
future	O
recoverability	O
include	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
reserves	O
and	O
resources	O
,	O
future	O
technological	O
changes	O
which	O
could	O
impact	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
mining	O
,	O
future	O
legal	O
changes	O
(	O
including	O
changes	O
to	O
environmental	O
restoration	O
obligations	O
)	O
and	O
changes	O
to	O
commodity	O
prices.	O
To	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
determined	O
not	O
to	O
be	O
recoverable	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
,	O
profits	O
and	O
net	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
reduced	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O
In	O
addition	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
is	O
capitalised	O
if	O
activities	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
have	O
not	O
yet	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
that	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O
recoverable	O
reserves.	O
To	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
that	O
this	O
capitalised	O
expenditure	O
should	O
be	O
written	O
off	O
,	O
profits	O
and	O
net	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
reduced	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
The	O
Company	O
measures	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
share-based	O
payment	O
transactions	O
with	O
employees	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
equity	O
instruments	O
at	O
the	O
grant	O
date.	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
using	O
a	O
valuation	O
model	O
,	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
in	O
note	O
23.	O
The	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
relating	O
to	O
equity-settled	O
share-based	O
payments	O
would	O
have	O
no	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
but	O
may	O
impact	O
expenses	O
and	O
equity.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
are	O
selected	O
and	O
applied	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
which	O
ensures	O
that	O
the	O
resulting	O
financial	O
information	O
satisfies	O
the	O
concepts	O
of	O
relevance	O
and	O
reliability	O
,	O
thereby	O
ensuring	O
that	O
the	O
substance	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
transactions	O
or	O
other	O
events	O
is	O
reported.	O
The	O
accounting	O
policies	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
have	O
been	O
applied	O
in	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
'company'	O
or	O
'parent	O
entity'	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
'consolidated	O
entity'.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
those	O
entities	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
control.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
control	O
is	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
They	O
are	O
de-consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O

Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
between	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
eliminated.	O
Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O
Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
The	O
acquisition	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
acquisition	O
method	O
of	O
accounting.	O
A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
,	O
without	O
the	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
,	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
an	O
equity	O
transaction	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
consideration	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
book	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
acquired	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
parent.	O
Non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
results	O
and	O
equity	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
shown	O
separately	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O
Losses	O
incurred	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
attributed	O
to	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
even	O
if	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
a	O
deficit	O
balance.	O
Where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
loses	O
control	O
over	O
a	O
subsidiary	O
,	O
it	O
derecognises	O
the	O
assets	O
including	O
goodwill	O
,	O
liabilities	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary	O
together	O
with	O
any	O
cumulative	O
translation	O
differences	O
recognised	O
in	O
equity.	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
recognises	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
received	O
and	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
any	O
investment	O
retained	O
together	O
with	O
any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O

maker	O
who	O
is	O

resources	O
and	O

has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
of	O

Resources	O
Limited.	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
Cash	O
and	O

equivalents	O

of	O

statement	O

at	O
call	O

or	O
financial	O
institutions.	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
Debt	O
and	O
equity	O
instruments	O
Debt	O
and	O

instruments	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
either	O

or	O
as	O
equity	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
substance	O
of	O
the	O
contractual	O
arrangement.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
on	O

of	O

instruments	O

a	O
reduction	O
of	O
the	O
proceeds	O
of	O
the	O

to	O
which	O
the	O
costs	O
relate.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O

are	O

directly	O
in	O
connection	O
with	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
those	O
equity	O
instruments	O
and	O
which	O
would	O
not	O
have	O
been	O
incurred	O
had	O
those	O
instruments	O
not	O
been	O
issued.	O
Interest	O
and	O
dividends	O

or	O

SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
e	O
)	O
Derivative	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
The	O
Group	O
enters	O
into	O
derivative	O
financial	O
instruments	O
to	O
manage	O
its	O
exposure	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
risk	O
,	O
including	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
forward	O
contracts.	O
Further	O
details	O
of	O
derivative	O
financial	O
instruments	O
are	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
18.	O
Derivatives	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
the	O
derivative	O
contract	O
is	O
entered	O
into	O
and	O
are	O
subsequently	O
remeasured	O
to	O
their	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period.	O
The	O
resulting	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
unless	O
the	O
derivative	O
is	O
designated	O
and	O
effective	O
as	O
a	O
hedging	O
instrument	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
event	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
recognition	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
hedge	O
relationship.	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
assets	O
At	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
entity	O
reviews	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
its	O
tangible	O
and	O
intangible	O
assets	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
there	O
is	O
any	O
indication	O
that	O
those	O
assets	O
have	O
suffered	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss.	O
If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
estimated	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
(	O
if	O
any	O
)	O
.	O

Where	O
the	O
asset	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
independent	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
estimates	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
belongs.	O
Recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
In	O
assessing	O
value	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
using	O
a	O
pre-	O
tax	O
discount	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
asset	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
estimates	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
adjusted.	O
If	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
(	O
or	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
estimated	O
to	O
be	O
less	O
than	O
its	O
carrying	O
amount	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
reduced	O
to	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
revaluation	O
decrease.	O
Where	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
subsequently	O
reverses	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
unit	O
)	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
increased	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
had	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
(	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
)	O
in	O
prior	O
periods.	O
A	O
reversal	O
of	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
immediately	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
relevant	O
asset	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
revaluation	O
increase.	O
(	O
g	O
)	O
Property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
Each	O
class	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
including	O
land	O
,	O
buildings	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
carried	O
at	O
cost	O
less	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
any	O
accumulated	O
depreciation.	O
Depreciation	O
Depreciation	O
is	O
provided	O
on	O
a	O
straight	O
line	O
basis	O
on	O
all	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
,	O
other	O
than	O

land.	O
This	O
is	O
done	O
over	O
the	O
useful	O
lives	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
commencing	O
from	O
the	O
time	O

is	O
held	O
ready	O
for	O
use.	O

)	O

)	O
Property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O

(	O

)	O

periods	O

of	O

:	O

of	O

asset	O
Depreciation	O
period	O

and	O

years	O

years	O

equipment	O
5	O
years	O

5	O
years	O
Buildings	O
10	O
years	O
(	O
h	O
)	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
Trade	O
payables	O
and	O
other	O
accounts	O
payable	O
are	O
recognised	O
when	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
becomes	O
obliged	O
to	O
make	O
future	O
payments	O
resulting	O
from	O
the	O
purchase	O
of	O
goods	O
and	O
services.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Provisions	O
Provisions	O
are	O
recognised	O
when	O
the	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
present	O
obligation	O
,	O
the	O
future	O
sacrifice	O
of	O
economic	O
benefits	O
is	O
probable	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
provision	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
provision	O
is	O
the	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
consideration	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
present	O
obligation	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
uncertainties	O
surrounding	O
the	O
obligation.	O
Where	O
a	O
provision	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
cashflows	O
estimated	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
present	O
obligation	O
,	O
its	O
carrying	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
those	O
cashflows.	O
When	O
some	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
economic	O
benefits	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
a	O
provision	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
recovered	O
from	O
a	O
third	O
party	O
,	O
the	O
receivable	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
virtually	O
certain	O
that	O
recovery	O
will	O
be	O
received	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
receivable	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O
(	O
j	O
)	O
Revenue	O
recognition	O
Dividend	O
and	O
interest	O
revenue	O
Dividend	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
on	O
a	O
receivable	O
basis.	O
Interest	O
revenue	O
is	O
recognised	O
on	O
a	O
time	O
proportionate	O
basis	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
effective	O
yield	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset.	O
(	O
k	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
Current	O
tax	O
Current	O
tax	O
is	O
calculated	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
income	O
taxes	O
payable	O
or	O
recoverable	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
tax	O
loss	O
for	O
the	O
period.	O
It	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
and	O
tax	O
laws	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
reporting	O
date.	O
Current	O
tax	O
for	O
current	O
and	O
prior	O
periods	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
liability	O
(	O
or	O
asset	O
)	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
unpaid	O
(	O
or	O
refundable	O
)	O
.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
comprehensive	O
liability	O
method	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
the	O
corresponding	O
tax	O
base	O
of	O
those	O
items.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

46	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O

TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
k	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
In	O
principle	O
,	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
all	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
against	O
which	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
or	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
and	O
tax	O
offsets	O
can	O
be	O
utilised.	O
However	O
,	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
if	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
them	O
arise	O
from	O
the	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
(	O
other	O
than	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
)	O
which	O
affects	O
neither	O
taxable	O
income	O
nor	O
accounting	O
profit.	O
Furthermore	O
,	O
a	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
not	O
recognised	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
goodwill.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
taxable	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
on	O
investments	O
in	O
subsidiaries	O
,	O
branches	O
,	O
associates	O
and	O
joint	O
ventures	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
arising	O
from	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
associated	O
with	O
these	O
investments	O
and	O
interests	O
are	O
only	O
recognised	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
there	O
will	O
be	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
profits	O
against	O
which	O
to	O
utilise	O
the	O
benefits	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
they	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
tax	O
rates	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
to	O
the	O
period	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
when	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
liability	O
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
them	O
are	O
realised	O
or	O
settled	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
tax	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
reporting	O
date.	O
The	O
measurement	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
reflects	O
the	O
tax	O
consequences	O
that	O
would	O
follow	O
from	O
the	O
manner	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
expects	O
,	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
to	O
recover	O
or	O
settle	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
they	O
relate	O
to	O
income	O
taxes	O
levied	O
by	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
intends	O
to	O
settle	O
its	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis.	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
or	O
income	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
when	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
credited	O
or	O
debited	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
to	O
equity	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
also	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
or	O
where	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
the	O
initial	O
accounting	O
for	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
taken	O
into	O
account	O
in	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
goodwill	O
or	O
excess.	O
(	O
l	O
)	O
Goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
Revenues	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
(	O
GST	O
)	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
Australian	O
Tax	O
Office	O
(	O
ATO	O
)	O
.	O

In	O
these	O
circumstances	O
the	O
GST	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
item	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O
Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
with	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
included.	O
The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
ATO	O
is	O
included	O
as	O
a	O
current	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O
Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O
The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
and	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
ATO	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O

and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O

47	O
2016	O
Annual	O

THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
(	O
m	O
)	O
Employee	O
benefits	O
Short-term	O
employee	O
benefits	O
Liabilities	O
for	O
wages	O
and	O
salaries	O
,	O
including	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
,	O
annual	O
leave	O
and	O
long	O
service	O
leave	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
current	O
liabilities	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
employees'	O
services	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
when	O
the	O
liabilities	O
are	O
settled.	O
Other	O
long-term	O
employee	O
benefits	O
The	O
liability	O
for	O
annual	O
leave	O
and	O
long	O
service	O
leave	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
non-current	O
liabilities	O
,	O
provided	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
unconditional	O
right	O
to	O
defer	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability.	O
The	O
liability	O
is	O
measured	O
as	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
expected	O
future	O
payments	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
services	O
provided	O
by	O
employees	O
up	O
to	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
using	O
the	O
projected	O
unit	O
credit	O
method.	O
Consideration	O
is	O
given	O
to	O
expected	O
future	O
wage	O
and	O
salary	O
levels	O
,	O
experience	O
of	O
employee	O
departures	O
and	O
periods	O
of	O
service.	O
Expected	O
future	O
payments	O
are	O
discounted	O
using	O
market	O
yields	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
on	O
national	O
government	O
bonds	O
with	O
terms	O
to	O
maturity	O
and	O
currency	O
that	O
match	O
,	O
as	O
closely	O
as	O
possible	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
outflows.	O
Defined	O
contribution	O
superannuation	O
expense	O
Contributions	O
to	O
defined	O
contribution	O
superannuation	O
plans	O
are	O
expensed	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
Equity-settled	O
and	O
cash-settled	O
share-based	O
compensation	O
benefits	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees.	O
Equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
shares	O
,	O
or	O
options	O
over	O
shares	O
that	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
the	O
rendering	O
of	O
services.	O
Cash-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
cash	O
for	O
the	O
exchange	O
of	O
services	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
cash	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
share	O
price.	O
The	O
costs	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
on	O
grant	O
date.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
independently	O
determined	O
using	O
either	O
the	O
Binomial	O
or	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
dilution	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
expected	O
price	O
volatility	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
share	O
,	O
the	O
expected	O
dividend	O
yield	O
and	O
the	O
risk	O
free	O
interest	O
rate	O
for	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
together	O
with	O
non-	O
vesting	O
conditions	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
determine	O
whether	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
receives	O
the	O
services	O
that	O
entitle	O
the	O
employees	O
to	O
receive	O
payment.	O
No	O
account	O
is	O
taken	O
of	O
any	O
other	O
vesting	O
conditions.	O
The	O
costs	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
over	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O
The	O
cumulative	O
charge	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
calculated	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
,	O
the	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
that	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O
vest	O
and	O
the	O
expired	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O
The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
is	O
the	O
cumulative	O
amount	O
calculated	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
less	O
amounts	O
already	O
recognised	O
in	O
previous	O
periods.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
Page	O
48	O
2016	O
Annual	O
Report	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2016	O
1.	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
(	O
m	O
)	O
Employee	O
benefits	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
The	O
cost	O
of	O
cash-settled	O
transactions	O
is	O
initially	O
,	O
and	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
until	O
vested	O
,	O
determined	O
by	O
applying	O
either	O
the	O
Binomial	O
or	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
consideration	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
on	O
which	O
the	O
award	O
was	O
granted.	O
The	O
cumulative	O
charge	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
until	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
is	O
calculated	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O
•	O

during	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
the	O
liability	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
is	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
at	O
that	O
date	O
multiplied	O
by	O
the	O
expired	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O
•	O

from	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
until	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
,	O
the	O
liability	O
is	O
the	O
full	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O
All	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
liability	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
The	O
ultimate	O
cost	O
of	O
cash-settled	O
transactions	O
is	O
the	O
cash	O
paid	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
liability.	O
Market	O
conditions	O
are	O
taken	O
into	O
consideration	O
in	O
determining	O
fair	O
value.	O
Therefore	O
any	O
awards	O
subject	O
to	O
market	O
conditions	O
are	O
considered	O
to	O
vest	O
irrespective	O
of	O
whether	O
or	O
not	O
that	O
market	O
condition	O
has	O
been	O
met	O
provided	O
all	O
other	O
conditions	O
are	O
satisfied.	O
If	O
equity-settled	O
awards	O
are	O
modified	O
,	O
as	O
a	O
minimum	O
an	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
if	O
the	O
modification	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
made.	O
An	O
additional	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
,	O
over	O
the	O
remaining	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
for	O
any	O
modification	O
that	O
increases	O
the	O
total	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share-based	O
compensation	O
benefit	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
modification.	O
If	O
the	O
non-vesting	O
condition	O
is	O
within	O
the	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
or	O
employee	O
,	O
the	O
failure	O
to	O
satisfy	O
the	O
condition	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
cancellation.	O
If	O
the	O
condition	O
is	O
not	O
within	O
the	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
or	O
employee	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
satisfied	O
during	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
any	O
remaining	O
expense	O
for	O
the	O
award	O
is	O
recognised	O
over	O
the	O
remaining	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
award	O
is	O
forfeited.	O
If	O
equity-settled	O
awards	O
are	O
cancelled	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
if	O
it	O
has	O
vested	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
cancellation	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
remaining	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
immediately.	O
If	O
a	O
new	O

)	O
Exploration	O
and	O

expenditure	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
Capitalised	O
exploration	O
costs	O
are	O
reviewed	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
to	O
test	O
whether	O
an	O
indication	O
of	O
impairment	O
exists.	O
If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
costs	O
is	O
estimated	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
(	O
if	O
any	O
)	O
.	O

Where	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
subsequently	O
reverses	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
increased	O
to	O
the	O
revised	O
estimate	O
of	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
increased	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
had	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
been	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
in	O
previous	O
years.	O
Where	O
a	O
decision	O
is	O
made	O
to	O
proceed	O
with	O
development	O
,	O
accumulated	O
expenditure	O
is	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
and	O
transferred	O
to	O
capitalised	O
development	O
and	O
then	O
amortised	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
reserve	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
once	O
mining	O
operations	O
have	O

Development	O

is	O
recognised	O
at	O
cost	O
less	O
any	O
impairment	O
of	O
losses.	O
Where	O
commercial	O
production	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
has	O
commenced	O
,	O
the	O
associated	O
costs	O
are	O
amortised	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
reserves	O

with	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O

are	O

with	O
on	O
a	O
prospective	O
basis.	O
(	O
q	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principle	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interest.	O
For	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
its	O
highest	O
and	O
best	O
use.	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O
Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O
For	O
recurring	O
and	O
non-recurring	O
fair	O
value	O
measurements	O
,	O
external	O
valuers	O
may	O
be	O
used	O
when	O
internal	O
expertise	O
is	O
either	O
not	O
available	O
or	O
when	O
the	O
valuation	O
is	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
significant.	O
External	O
valuers	O
are	O
selected	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
knowledge	O
and	O
reputation.	O
Where	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
significant	O
change	O
in	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
from	O
one	O
period	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
an	O
analysis	O
is	O
undertaken	O
,	O
which	O
includes	O
a	O
verification	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
inputs	O
applied	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
valuation	O
and	O
a	O
comparison	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
with	O
external	O
sources	O
of	O
data.	O

Resources	O

and	O
its	O

equity	O

,	O

the	O
proceeds.	O

of	O
new	O

or	O
options	O
for	O
the	O

of	O
a	O
business	O
are	O
not	O
included	O
in	O

of	O
acquisition	O
as	O

of	O

)	O

directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
Acquisition	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
goodwill	O
The	O
purchase	O
method	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
all	O

of	O
assets	O
(	O

business	O

)	O
regardless	O
of	O
whether	O
equity	O
instruments	O
or	O
other	O
assets	O
are	O
acquired.	O
Cost	O
is	O
measured	O
as	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
assets	O
given	O
,	O
shares	O
issued	O
or	O
liabilities	O
incurred	O
or	O
assumed	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
plus	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition.	O
Where	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
issued	O
in	O
an	O

,	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
instruments	O
is	O
their	O

market	O
price	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
unless	O
,	O
in	O
rare	O
circumstances	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
demonstrated	O
that	O

published	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange	O
is	O
an	O
unreliable	O
measure	O
of	O
fair	O
value.	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
equity	O
instruments	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O
Identifiable	O
assets	O
acquired	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
contingent	O
liabilities	O
assumed	O
in	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
are	O
measured	O
initially	O
at	O
their	O
fair	O
values	O
at	O
the	O
acquisition	O
date	O
,	O
irrespective	O
of	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
any	O
minority	O
interest.	O
The	O
excess	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
over	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
identifiable	O
net	O
assets	O
acquired	O
is	O
recorded	O
as	O
goodwill	O
and	O
not	O
amortised	O
,	O
but	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
annually	O
and	O
whenever	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
indication	O
that	O
the	O
goodwill	O
may	O
be	O
impaired.	O
Any	O
impairment	O
is	O
recognised	O
immediately	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
subsequently	O
reversed.	O
If	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
is	O
less	O
than	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
combination	O
,	O
the	O
difference	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O
Where	O
settlement	O
of	O
any	O
part	O
of	O
cash	O
consideration	O
is	O
deferred	O
,	O
the	O
amounts	O
payable	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
exchange.	O
The	O
discount	O
rate	O
used	O
is	O
the	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
incremental	O
borrowing	O
rate	O
,	O
being	O
the	O
rate	O
at	O
which	O
a	O
similar	O
borrowing	O
could	O
be	O
obtained	O
from	O
an	O
independent	O
financier	O
under	O
comparable	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions.	O
(	O
t	O
)	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O
Collectability	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
is	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O
Debts	O
which	O
are	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
uncollectible	O
are	O
written	O
off.	O
An	O
allowance	O
for	O
doubtful	O
receivables	O
is	O
established	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
objective	O
evidence	O
that	O
the	O
Entity	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
collect	O
all	O
amounts	O
due	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
original	O
terms	O
of	O
receivables.	O
The	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
allowance	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O
The	O
movement	O
of	O
the	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

(	O

)	O
Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O
safeguard	O
their	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
can	O
continue	O
its	O
activities	O
and	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
other	O
stakeholders.	O
It	O
is	O
the	O
board	O
’	O
s	O
current	O
policy	O
,	O
which	O
it	O
has	O
operated	O
since	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
inception	O
,	O
that	O
given	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
its	O
business	O
,	O
to	O
fund	O
its	O
operations	O
without	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
external	O
borrowings.	O
The	O
board	O
undertakes	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
an	O
annual	O
budget	O
to	O
assess	O
its	O
expected	O
capital	O
needs	O
and	O
to	O
ensure	O
sufficient	O
capital	O
is	O
available	O
to	O
meet	O
those	O
needs.	O
The	O
financial	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
a	O
regular	O
basis	O
against	O
this	O
budget	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
meeting	O
its	O
cash	O
inflow	O
and	O
outflow	O
targets.	O
In	O
order	O
maintain	O
its	O
capital	O
structure	O
and	O
to	O
maintain	O
its	O
policy	O
of	O
no	O
external	O
borrowings	O
,	O
to	O
support	O
its	O
ongoing	O
operations	O
,	O
the	O
company	O
may	O
issue	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
sell	O
assets	O
to	O
provide	O
ongoing	O
funding	O
of	O
its	O

18.	O
FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Group	O
attempts	O
to	O
mitigate	O
risks	O
that	O
may	O
affect	O
its	O
future	O
performance	O
through	O
a	O
process	O
of	O
identifying	O
,	O
assessing	O
,	O
reporting	O
and	O
managing	O
risks	O
of	O
corporate	O
significance.	O
The	O
board	O
considers	O
the	O
principal	O
risks	O
of	O
our	O
business	O
,	O
particularly	O
during	O
the	O
strategic	O
planning	O
and	O
budget	O
processes.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
principal	O
financial	O
instruments	O
comprise	O
cash	O
,	O
short-term	O
deposits	O
and	O
investments	O
in	O
shares.	O
The	O
main	O
purpose	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
instruments	O
is	O
to	O
fund	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
operations.	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
various	O
other	O
financial	O
instruments	O
such	O
as	O
trade	O
debtors	O
,	O
trade	O
creditors	O
and	O
borrowings	O
,	O
which	O
arise	O
directly	O
from	O
its	O
operations.	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
Page	O
62	O
2016	O
Annual	O

the	O

2016	O
18.	O
FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
(	O
Cont.	O
)	O
The	O
main	O
risks	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
instruments	O
is	O
cash	O
flow	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
and	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk.	O
Other	O
minor	O
risks	O
include	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
and	O
capital	O
risk	O
management.	O
The	O
board	O
reviews	O
and	O
adopts	O
policies	O
for	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
risks	O
which	O
are	O
summarised	O
below.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Credit	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
any	O
material	O
credit	O
risk	O
exposure	O
to	O
any	O
single	O
debtor	O
or	O
group	O
of	O
debtors	O
under	O
financial	O
instruments	O
entered	O
into	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
other	O
than	O
receivables	O
that	O
potentially	O
subject	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
concentrations	O
of	O
credit	O
risk	O
consist	O
principally	O
of	O
cash	O
deposits.	O
The	O
Group	O
places	O
its	O
cash	O
deposits	O
with	O
high	O
credit	O
quality	O
financial	O
institutions	O
,	O
being	O
in	O
Australia	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
Australian	O
(	O
big	O
four	O
)	O
banks.	O
Cash	O
holdings	O
in	O
other	O
countries	O
are	O
not	O
significant.	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
cash	O
deposits	O
are	O
all	O
on	O
call	O
or	O
in	O
term	O
deposits	O
and	O
attract	O
a	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
normal	O
short	O
term	O
money	O
market	O
rates.	O
The	O
maximum	O
amount	O
of	O
credit	O
risk	O
the	O
Group	O
considers	O
it	O
would	O
be	O
exposed	O
to	O
would	O
be	O
$10	O
,	O
831	O
,	O
716	O
(	O
2015	O
:	O
$871	O
,	O
871	O
)	O

of	O
its	O

values	O
of	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O

)	O
Foreign	O
Exchange	O
Risk	O
A	O
risk	O
arises	O
when	O
future	O
commercial	O
transactions	O
and	O
recognised	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
other	O
than	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
functional	O
currency.	O
The	O
Group	O
operates	O
internationally	O
,	O
with	O
its	O
major	O
assets	O
being	O
held	O
in	O
Mali	O
,	O
West	O
Africa	O
and	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arising	O
from	O
currency	O
exposures	O
to	O
the	O
Euro	O
,	O
FCFA	O
(	O
fixed	O
to	O
the	O
Euro	O
)	O
and	O
US	O
Dollar.	O
Historically	O
,	O
given	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
expenditure	O
and	O
available	O
funding	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
considered	O
its	O
exposure	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
was	O
minimal	O
and	O
hedging	O
policies	O
were	O
not	O
adopted.	O
Following	O
the	O
$10	O
million	O
capital	O
raising	O
completed	O
in	O
June	O
2016	O
,	O
given	O
the	O
particularly	O
volatile	O
and	O
uncertain	O
position	O
of	O
foreign	O
currency	O
markets	O
globally	O

time	O
and	O

that	O

program	O
would	O

completed	O
in	O
the	O
following	O

months	O

and	O
management	O

to	O
enter	O
into	O

possible	O

•	O

the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
financial	O

and	O

of	O

financial	O

SEGMENT	O
INFORMATION	O

2016	O
the	O

(	O

.	O

the	O
year	O

’	O
s	O

in	O

is	O

policies	O
of	O

are	O
the	O

as	O

was	O
$0.07	O
per	O
option	O
(	O
2015	O
:	O
$0.10	O
)	O
.	O

(	O
f	O
)	O
Share	O
option	O
plan	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
an	O
Incentive	O
Option	O
Scheme	O
(	O
“	O
Scheme	O
”	O
)	O
for	O
executives	O
and	O
employees	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
Scheme	O
,	O
as	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
shareholders	O
at	O
the	O
August	O
2016	O
annual	O
general	O
meeting	O
,	O
executives	O
and	O
employees	O
may	O
be	O
granted	O
options	O
at	O
the	O
discretion	O
of	O
the	O
directors.	O
Each	O
share	O
option	O
converts	O
into	O
one	O
ordinary	O
share	O
of	O
Oklo	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
on	O
exercise.	O
No	O
amounts	O
are	O
paid	O
or	O
are	O
payable	O
by	O
the	O
recipient	O
on	O
receipt	O
of	O
the	O
option.	O
The	O
options	O
carry	O
neither	O
rights	O
of	O
dividends	O
nor	O
voting	O
rights.	O
Options	O
may	O
be	O
exercised	O
at	O
any	O
time	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
vesting	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
their	O
expiry.	O
Options	O
issued	O
to	O
directors	O
are	O
not	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Scheme	O
but	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
approval	O
by	O
shareholders.	O

Directors	O
’	O
Responsibility	O
for	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
theCorporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
In	O
Note	O
1	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
also	O
state	O
,	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Accounting	O
Standard	O
AASB	O
101	O
Presentation	O
of	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
,	O
that	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
comply	O
withInternational	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards.	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Responsibility	O
Our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
express	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
based	O
on	O
our	O
audit.	O
We	O
conducted	O
our	O
audit	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards.	O
Those	O
standards	O
require	O
that	O
we	O
comply	O
with	O
relevant	O
ethical	O
requirements	O
relating	O
to	O
audit	O
engagements	O
and	O
plan	O
and	O
perform	O
the	O
audit	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement.	O
An	O
audit	O
involves	O
performing	O
procedures	O
to	O
obtain	O
audit	O
evidence	O
about	O
the	O
amounts	O
and	O
disclosures	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
The	O
procedures	O
selected	O
depend	O
on	O
the	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
judgement	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O
In	O
making	O
those	O
risk	O
assessments	O
,	O
the	O
auditor	O
considers	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
design	O
audit	O
procedures	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
expressing	O
an	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
effectiveness	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
internal	O
control.	O
An	O
audit	O
also	O
includes	O
evaluating	O
the	O
appropriateness	O
of	O
accounting	O
policies	O
used	O
and	O
the	O
reasonableness	O
of	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
made	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
evaluating	O
the	O
overall	O
presentation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O
We	O
believe	O
that	O
the	O
audit	O
evidence	O
we	O
have	O
obtained	O
is	O
sufficient	O
and	O
appropriate	O
to	O
provide	O
a	O
basis	O
for	O
our	O
audit	O
opinion.	O
Independence	O

our	O
audit	O
,	O
we	O
have	O

with	O
the	O

CHAIRMAN	O
’	O
S	O
LETTER	O
Dear	O
Shareholders	O
The	O
2021	O
financial	O
year	O
has	O
been	O
an	O
exciting	O
year	O
for	O
your	O
company	O
,	O
with	O
successes	O
achieved	O
at	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
(	O
Au/Cu	O
)	O
,	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
(	O
Au	O
)	O
and	O
Lake	O
Johnstone	O
(	O
Ni	O
)	O
.	O

In	O
all	O
,	O
over	O
34	O
,	O
000	O
metres	O
of	O
diamond/RC/aircore	O
was	O
drilled	O
and	O
significant	O
auger	O
and	O
geophysical	O
surveys	O
were	O
completed.	O
It	O
is	O
pleasing	O
to	O
report	O
that	O
the	O
safety	O
,	O
environmental	O
and	O
community	O
performance	O
at	O
our	O
projects	O
has	O
again	O
been	O
excellent	O
and	O
congratulate	O
all	O
staff	O
and	O
contractors	O
for	O
their	O
preparation	O
and	O
diligence	O
,	O
especially	O
while	O
carrying	O
out	O
their	O
fieldwork.	O
As	O
100%	O
operator	O
in	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
(	O
266	O
sq	O
km	O
)	O
,	O
we	O
extended	O
our	O
knowledge	O
of	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
at	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
,	O
Hang	O
Glider	O
Hill	O
and	O
Havelock	O
and	O
from	O
January	O
2001	O
we	O
conducted	O
several	O
large	O
drill	O
and	O
geophysical	O
programs	O
to	O
define	O
Au/Cu	O
mineralisation	O
trends	O
at	O
the	O
newly	O
acquired	O
Burns	O
project.	O
At	O
the	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
project	O
(	O
372	O
sq	O
km	O
)	O
,	O
our	O
partner	O
Goldfields	O
completed	O
14	O
,	O
723m	O
of	O
drilling	O
and	O
in	O
June	O
2021	O
decided	O
to	O
exercise	O
its	O
option	O
to	O
purchase	O
50%	O
of	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
and	O
spend	O
up	O
to	O
another	O
$15m	O
over	O
the	O
next	O
three	O
years	O
seeking	O
major	O
discoveries	O
under/around	O
Lake	O
Lefroy.	O
The	O
commercial	O
arrangements	O
for	O
the	O
extension	O
included	O
return	O
of	O
the	O
high	O
potential	O
Coogee	O
South	O
area	O
to	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
project	O
and	O
$1.38m	O
cash.	O
At	O
Lake	O
Johnson	O
we	O
have	O
confirmed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
nickel	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
started	O
planning	O
for	O
exploration	O
to	O
define	O
mineable	O
nickel	O
resources	O
in	O
the	O
coming	O
year.	O
Undoubtedly	O
the	O
highlight	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
was	O
the	O
high-grade	O
Au/Cu	O
intercept	O
at	O
Burns	O
in	O
March	O
2021.	O
We	O
will	O
do	O
more	O
to	O
properly	O
follow	O
this	O
up	O
in	O
the	O
near	O
future	O
,	O
but	O
are	O
currently	O
constrained	O
by	O
long	O
assay	O
times.	O
What	O
we	O
already	O
know	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
is	O
that	O
Burns	O
is	O
a	O
very	O
exciting	O
area.	O
It	O
is	O
abundantly	O
clear	O
that	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
metal	O
we	O
have	O
found	O
already	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
our	O
exploration	O
has	O
been	O
limited	O
to	O
date	O
,	O
shows	O
that	O
we	O
have	O
only	O
scratched	O
the	O
surface	O
of	O
what	O
we	O
will	O
define	O
in	O
the	O
Burns	O
area.	O
This	O
could	O
include	O
large	O
tonnage	O
,	O
low	O
to	O
medium	O
grade	O
open	O
pittable	O
Cu/Au	O
mineralisation	O
in	O
the	O
western	O
basalt	O
zone	O
and	O
higher-grade	O
Au	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Porphyry.	O
We	O
have	O
recently	O
been	O
granted	O
approval	O
to	O
explore	O
on	O
Lake	O
Randall	O
as	O

project	O

will	O
start	O

on	O

year	O

2021.	O

and	O

to	O

further	O

on	O

at	O
Coogee	O
South.	O

at	O

and	O
Hang	O
Glider	O

the	O
100	O

000	O
ounces	O

EXPLORATION	O
OVERVIEW	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
(	O
‘	O
LGP	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
some	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
South	O
East	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Goldfields	O
Province	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
project.	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
(	O
LGP	O
)	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
is	O
wholly	O
owned	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
located	O
approximately	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
south	O
east	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Goldfields	O
Province	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
(	O
Figure	O
1	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
commanding	O
,	O
semi-contiguous	O
,	O
granted	O
land	O
package	O
covers	O
637.6km2	O
immediately	O
east	O
of	O
and	O
adjoining	O
the	O
world	O
class	O
+10Moz	O
St	O
Ives	O
Gold	O
camp	O
,	O
operated	O
by	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
Limited	O
(	O
NYSE	O
:	O
GFI	O
)	O
(	O
“	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
immediately	O
south	O
of	O
the	O
high-grade	O
Mt	O
Monger	O
gold	O
centre	O
operated	O
by	O
Silver	O
Lake	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
SLR	O
)	O
(	O
“	O
Silver	O
Lake	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

Four	O
gold	O
processing	O
operations	O
are	O
strategically	O
located	O
within	O
50km	O
of	O
the	O
project	O
and	O
provide	O
commercial	O
options	O
for	O
processing	O
any	O
gold	O
resources	O
discovered.	O
LGP	O

operations	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
those	O
operations	O
,	O
or	O

of	O

ENVIRONMENTAL	O
REGULATION	O
AND	O
PERFORMANCE	O

to	O

regulation	O
in	O

to	O
its	O
exploration	O

DIRECTORS	O
’	O

)	O

Group	O

to	O

appropriate	O
standard	O
of	O

care	O
is	O
achieved	O

and	O

and	O

all	O

(	O

)	O
Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
objectives	O
with	O
shareholder	O
and	O
business	O
objectives	O
by	O
providing	O
a	O
fixed	O
remuneration	O
component	O
and	O
offering	O
long-term	O
incentives	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate.	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
believes	O
the	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
is	O
effective	O
in	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitable	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
to	O
manage	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
activities.	O
The	O
board	O
will	O
review	O
executive	O
packages	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
considers	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
its	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
and	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
performance	O
,	O
executive	O
performance	O
and	O
comparable	O
information	O
from	O
industry	O
sectors	O
and	O
other	O
listed	O
companies	O
in	O
similar	O
industries.	O
The	O
Board	O
may	O
exercise	O
discretion	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
approving	O
incentives	O
,	O
bonuses	O
and	O
shares	O
under	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Share	O
Plan	O
Trust	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O
The	O
policy	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
for	O
performance	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
long-term	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O
The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
the	O
superannuation	O
guarantee	O
contribution	O
required	O
by	O
the	O
government	O
of	O
Australia	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
9.5%	O
for	O
the	O
2021	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
entitled	O
to	O
receive	O
any	O
other	O
retirement	O
benefits.	O
The	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
at	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
comparable	O
companies	O
for	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O
The	O
Board	O
determines	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
and	O
reviews	O
their	O
remuneration	O
annually	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
practice	O
,	O
duties	O
and	O
accountability.	O
Independent	O
external	O
advice	O
is	O
sought	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
required.	O
To	O
align	O
directors	O
’	O
interests	O
with	O
shareholder	O
interests	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
hold	O
shares	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
Performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
The	O
Group	O
utilises	O
performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
motivate	O
directors	O
and	O
employees	O
and	O
has	O

Lefroy	O

Ltd	O

shareholders	O

hurdles	O

Statements.	O
Page	O
27	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
1	O
:	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consisting	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
“	O
the	O
Group	O
”	O
or	O
“	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars.	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
,	O
incorporated	O
in	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
laws	O
of	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands	O
on	O
14	O
May	O
1990	O
under	O
the	O
BVI	O
Business	O
Companies	O
Act.	O
The	O
Company	O
maintains	O
registered	O
offices	O
in	O
Western	O
Australian	O
and	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands.	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
on	O
29	O
September	O
2021.	O
The	O
directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
“	O
IFRS	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
“	O
IASB	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
The	O
Group	O
applied	O
all	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
that	O
were	O
effective	O
1	O
July	O
2020	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
Amendments	O
on	O
IFRS	O
3	O
–	O

Definition	O
of	O
a	O
Business	O
Amendments	O
to	O
IFRS	O
3	O
to	O
clarify	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
,	O
assisting	O
entities	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
a	O
transaction	O
should	O
be	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
or	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
acquisition.	O
The	O
amendments	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
clarify	O
that	O
to	O
be	O
considered	O
a	O
business	O
,	O
an	O
acquired	O
set	O
of	O
activities	O
and	O
assets	O
must	O
include	O
,	O
at	O
a	O
minimum	O
,	O
an	O
input	O
and	O
a	O
substantive	O
process	O
that	O
together	O
significantly	O
contribute	O
to	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
create	O
outputs	O
;	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
remove	O
the	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
market	O
participants	O
are	O
capable	O
of	O
replacing	O
any	O
missing	O
inputs	O
or	O
processes	O
and	O
continuing	O
to	O
produce	O
outputs	O
;	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
add	O
guidance	O
and	O
illustrative	O
examples	O
to	O
help	O
entities	O
assess	O
whether	O
a	O
substantive	O
process	O
has	O
been	O
acquired	O
;	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
narrow	O
the	O
definitions	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
and	O
of	O
outputs	O
by	O
focusing	O
on	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
customers	O
and	O
by	O
removing	O
the	O
reference	O
to	O
an	O
ability	O
to	O
reduce	O
costs	O
;	O
and	O
(	O
e	O
)	O
add	O
an	O
optional	O
concentration	O
test	O
that	O
permits	O
a	O
simplified	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
an	O
acquired	O
set	O
of	O
activities	O
and	O
assets	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
business.	O
The	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
3	O
has	O
not	O
materially	O
impacted	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
Amendments	O
on	O
IAS	O
1	O
and	O
IAS	O
8	O
–	O

Definition	O
of	O
Material	O
This	O
standard	O
principally	O
amends	O
IAS	O
1	O
Presentation	O
of	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
and	O
IAS	O
8	O
Accounting	O
Policies	O
,	O
Changes	O
in	O
Accounting	O
Estimates	O
and	O
Errors.	O
The	O
amendments	O
refine	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
material	O
in	O
IAS	O
1.	O
The	O
amendments	O
clarify	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
material	O
and	O
its	O
application	O
by	O
improving	O
the	O
wording	O
and	O
aligning	O
the	O
definition	O
across	O
IFRS	O
Standards	O
and	O
other	O
publications.	O
The	O
amendment	O
also	O
includes	O
some	O
supporting	O
requirements	O
in	O
IAS	O
1	O
in	O
the	O
definition	O
to	O
give	O
it	O
more	O
prominence	O
and	O
clarifies	O
the	O
explanation	O
accompanying	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
material.	O
The	O
application	O
of	O
this	O
amendments	O
has	O
not	O
materially	O
impacted	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Early	O
adoption	O
of	O
standards	O
The	O
Group	O
did	O
not	O
elect	O
to	O
apply	O
any	O
pronouncements	O
before	O
their	O
operative	O
date	O
in	O
the	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
beginning	O
1	O
July	O
2020.	O
(	O
iii	O
)	O
Historical	O
cost	O
convention	O
Except	O
for	O
certain	O
financial	O
assets	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
under	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
convention.	O
(	O
iv	O
)	O
Going	O
concern	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O
continuity	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
activities	O
and	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O
Page	O
28	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
incurred	O
a	O
net	O
loss	O
after	O
tax	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
of	O
$1	O
,	O
133	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
30	O
June	O
2020	O
:	O
loss	O
$379	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
and	O

a	O
net	O

outflow	O
from	O

and	O
investing	O
activities	O
of	O
$2	O
,	O
036	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
30	O
June	O
2020	O
:	O
$2	O
,	O
988	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
net	O
assets	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
were	O
$14	O
,	O
684	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
30	O
June	O
2020	O
:	O
$11	O
,	O
233	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecasts	O
through	O
to	O
30	O
September	O
2022	O
reflect	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
will	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
raise	O
additional	O
working	O
capital	O
during	O
this	O
period	O
to	O
enable	O
it	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
committed	O
administration	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
operational	O
expenditure	O
over	O
this	O
period.	O
The	O
Directors	O
are	O
satisfied	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
will	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
secure	O
additional	O
working	O
capital	O
as	O
required	O

one	O
or	O
a	O

of	O
,	O
a	O

it	O

to	O

financial	O

on	O

)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
an	O
entity	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O

and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
whose	O

results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
entity's	O
chief	O

decision	O
maker	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O
Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
chief	O

decision	O
maker.	O
The	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
,	O
who	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
allocating	O
resources	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors.	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
The	O
income	O
tax	O
expense	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
is	O
the	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
’	O
s	O
taxable	O
income	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
applicable	O
income	O
tax	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction	O
adjusted	O
by	O
changes	O
in	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
attributable	O
to	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
to	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses.	O
The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
charge	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
tax	O
laws	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
the	O
countries	O
where	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
operate	O
and	O
generate	O
taxable	O
income.	O
Management	O
periodically	O
evaluates	O
positions	O
taken	O
in	O
tax	O
returns	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
situations	O
in	O
which	O
applicable	O
tax	O
regulation	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interpretation.	O
It	O
establishes	O
provisions	O
where	O
appropriate	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authorities.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
on	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
between	O

of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
not	O
accounted	O
for	O
if	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
other	O
than	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
that	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
affects	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O
Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
determined	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
when	O
the	O
related	O

tax	O
asset	O
is	O
realised	O
or	O
a	O

income	O
tax	O

is	O
settled.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O

in	O
controlled	O

where	O

parent	O
entity	O
is	O

to	O
control	O

of	O

is	O

that	O

differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O

future.	O
Current	O
and	O

tax	O
assets	O
and	O

are	O

when	O

to	O
offset	O
current	O

the	O

,	O
or	O
to	O

the	O
asset	O
and	O

Current	O
and	O

tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
to	O
the	O

that	O
it	O

to	O
items	O

in	O
other	O

income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O

In	O

also	O

in	O
other	O

income	O

,	O

(	O
e	O
)	O
Leases	O
The	O
Group	O
assesses	O
at	O
contract	O

whether	O
a	O
contract	O
is	O
,	O
or	O
contains	O
,	O
a	O

is	O
,	O
if	O

for	O

assets	O

30	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O

at	O
cost	O
,	O
less	O
any	O

depreciation	O
and	O
impairment	O
losses	O

and	O
adjusted	O
for	O
any	O

of	O
lease	O
liabilities.	O
The	O

of	O

assets	O
includes	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
lease	O
liabilities	O
recognised	O

,	O
and	O
lease	O
payments	O
made	O
at	O
or	O
before	O
the	O

date	O
less	O
any	O

received.	O
Unless	O

Group	O
is	O
reasonably	O
certain	O
to	O

of	O

asset	O

over	O
the	O
shorter	O
of	O
its	O
estimated	O
useful	O
life	O
and	O
the	O
lease	O
term.	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
impairment.	O

liabilities	O

liabilities	O
are	O

for	O
on	O
a	O
similar	O
basis	O
to	O
other	O
financial	O
liabilities	O

whereby	O
interest	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
liability	O
and	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
reduced	O
to	O
reflect	O
the	O
principal	O
portion	O
of	O
lease	O
payments	O
made.	O
Short-term	O
leases	O
and	O
leases	O
of	O
low	O
value	O
assets	O
The	O
Group	O
applies	O
the	O

lease	O
recognition	O

to	O
its	O
short-term	O
leases	O
of	O

and	O

rental	O
(	O
i.e.	O
those	O
leases	O
that	O
have	O
a	O
lease	O
term	O
of	O
12	O
months	O
or	O
less	O
from	O
the	O
commencement	O
date	O
and	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O

option	O
)	O
.	O

(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
non-current	O
assets	O
Non-current	O
assets	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
impairment	O
whenever	O
events	O
or	O
changes	O
in	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
recoverable.	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
amount	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O
For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
assessing	O
impairment	O
,	O
assets	O
are	O
grouped	O
at	O
the	O
lowest	O
levels	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
separately	O
identifiable	O
cash	O
inflows	O
which	O
are	O
largely	O
independent	O
of	O
the	O
cash	O
inflows	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
or	O
groups	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
units	O
)	O
.	O

Non-financial	O
assets	O
that	O

are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
possible	O
reversal	O
of	O

at	O

date.	O
(	O
g	O
)	O
Cash	O

Financial	O

Financial	O
assets	O
Financial	O

cost	O

other	O

income	O
(	O
OCI	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O
The	O
classification	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
contractual	O
cashflow	O
characteristics	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O

business	O

for	O

With	O

a	O

and	O
loss	O
,	O
less	O
transaction	O

at	O
amortised	O
cost	O

to	O

to	O

by	O

credit	O

Changes	O
in	O
Accounting	O
Estimates	O
and	O
Errors	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
Critical	O
accounting	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
requires	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
certain	O
critical	O
accounting	O
estimates.	O
It	O
also	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
exercise	O
its	O
judgement	O
in	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
applying	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies.	O
The	O
areas	O
involving	O
a	O
higher	O
degree	O
of	O
judgement	O
or	O
complexity	O
,	O
or	O
areas	O
where	O
assumptions	O
and	O
estimates	O
are	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
:	O
Rehabilitation	O
provision	O
The	O
ultimate	O
rehabilitation	O
costs	O
are	O
uncertain	O
,	O
and	O
cost	O
estimates	O
can	O
vary	O
in	O
response	O
to	O
many	O
factors	O
,	O
including	O
estimates	O
of	O
the	O
extent	O
and	O
costs	O
of	O
rehabilitation	O
activities	O
,	O
technological	O
changes	O
,	O
regulatory	O
changes	O
and	O
cost	O
increases.	O
These	O
uncertainties	O
may	O
result	O
in	O
future	O
actual	O
expenditure	O
differing	O
from	O
the	O
amounts	O
currently	O
provided.	O
Therefore	O
,	O
significant	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
are	O
made	O
in	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
for	O
rehabilitation.	O
As	O
a	O
result	O
,	O
there	O
could	O
be	O
significant	O
adjustments	O
to	O
the	O
provisions	O
established	O
which	O
would	O
affect	O
future	O
financial	O
results.	O
The	O
provision	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
represents	O
management	O
’	O
s	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
future	O
rehabilitation	O
costs	O
required.	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
costs	O
The	O
application	O
of	O
the	O
accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
exploration	O
expenditure	O
requires	O
judgement	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
is	O
considered	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
recoverable	O
by	O
future	O
exploitation	O
or	O
sale	O
or	O
where	O
the	O
activities	O
have	O
not	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
which	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
of	O
reserves.	O
This	O
policy	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
make	O
certain	O
estimates	O
as	O
to	O
future	O
events	O
and	O
circumstances	O
,	O
in	O
particular	O
whether	O
an	O
economically	O
viable	O
extraction	O
operation	O
can	O
be	O
established.	O
Any	O
such	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
may	O
change	O
as	O
new	O
information	O
becomes	O
available.	O
If	O
,	O
after	O
having	O
capitalised	O
the	O
expenditure	O
under	O
the	O
policy	O
,	O
a	O
judgement	O
is	O
made	O
that	O
the	O
recovery	O
of	O
the	O
expenditure	O
is	O
unlikely	O
,	O
the	O
relevant	O
capitalised	O
amount	O
will	O
be	O
written	O
off	O
to	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O
Taxation	O
Balances	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
the	O
notes	O
thereto	O
related	O
to	O
taxation	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
best	O
estimates	O
of	O
the	O
directors.	O
These	O
estimates	O
take	O
into	O
account	O
both	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
and	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
they	O
pertain	O
to	O
current	O
income	O
taxation	O
legislation	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
directors	O
understanding	O
thereof.	O
No	O
adjustment	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
for	O
pending	O
or	O
future	O
taxation	O
legislation.	O
The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
position	O
represents	O
that	O
directors	O
’	O
best	O
estimate	O
,	O
pending	O
an	O
assessment	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office.	O
Impairment	O
The	O
Group	O
assesses	O
impairment	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
by	O
evaluating	O
conditions	O
and	O
events	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
indicative	O
of	O
impairment	O
triggers.	O
Recoverable	O
amounts	O
of	O
relevant	O
assets	O
are	O
reassessed	O
only	O
when	O
a	O
trigger	O
is	O
identified	O
using	O
the	O
directors	O
’	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O

fair	O
value	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
incorporate	O
various	O
key	O
assumptions.	O

2	O

FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
expose	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
financial	O
risks	O
:	O
market	O
risk	O
(	O
including	O
currency	O
risk	O
,	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
,	O
commodity	O
price	O
risk	O
and	O
equity	O
price	O
risk	O
)	O
,	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
liquidity	O
risk.	O
Risk	O
management	O
is	O
carried	O
out	O
by	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
as	O
the	O
Group	O
believes	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
crucial	O
for	O
all	O
board	O
members	O
to	O
be	O
involved	O
in	O
this	O
process.	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
Market	O
risk	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
operates	O
entirely	O
in	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
significantly	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk.	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
Commodity	O
price	O
risk	O
Given	O
the	O
current	O
level	O
of	O
operations	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
are	O
not	O
exposed	O
to	O
commodity	O
price	O
risk.	O
(	O
iii	O
)	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
movements	O
in	O
market	O
interest	O
rates	O
on	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O
The	O
Group	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
monitor	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
yield	O
curve	O
out	O
to	O
six	O
months	O
to	O
ensure	O
a	O
balance	O
is	O
maintained	O
between	O
the	O
liquidity	O
of	O
cash	O
assets	O
and	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
return.	O
The	O
entire	O
balance	O
of	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
for	O
the	O
Group	O
of	O
$3	O
,	O
354	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
$907	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk.	O
The	O
weighted	O

rate	O
received	O
on	O

and	O

by	O
the	O
Group	O
was	O
0.16%	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
0.42%	O
)	O
.	O

(	O
b	O
)	O
Credit	O
risk	O

(	O
c	O
)	O

1	O

(	O

from	O
prices	O
)	O
.	O

Level	O
3	O
:	O

fair	O
value	O
is	O

inputs	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
that	O
are	O
not	O

on	O

data.	O

value	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O

Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O

defines	O
capital	O
as	O
issued	O
share	O
capital.	O
Its	O
objective	O
when	O

to	O

as	O

so	O

to	O

,	O
being	O

exploration	O

the	O

does	O
not	O
have	O
ready	O

to	O
credit	O
facilities	O
,	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
Corporate	O
Governance.	O
The	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
to	O
its	O
Shareholders	O
for	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O
communicate	O
with	O
Shareholders.	O

accordance	O
with	O
ASX	O
Listing	O
Rule	O
4.10.3	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
elected	O
to	O

its	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
policies	O
and	O
its	O
compliance	O
with	O
them	O
on	O
its	O
website	O
,	O

than	O
in	O
the	O

practices	O
is	O

53	O
CHAIRMANS	O
’	O
LETTER	O
Dear	O
Shareholders	O
The	O
2019	O
financial	O
year	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
second	O
full	O
year	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
’	O
s	O
exploration	O
activities.	O
Before	O
moving	O
onto	O
LEX	O
’	O
s	O
plans	O
it	O
is	O
clear	O
that	O
the	O
current	O
gold	O
price	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollar	O
terms	O
,	O
is	O
very	O
supportive	O
of	O
gold	O
exploration.	O
Gold	O
continues	O
to	O
play	O
its	O
part	O
as	O
a	O
stable	O
value	O
asset	O
in	O
uncertain	O
times.	O
The	O
advent	O
of	O
negative	O
interest	O
rates	O
should	O
also	O
support	O
gold	O
for	O
many	O
years	O
into	O
the	O
future.	O
In	O
this	O
environment	O
even	O
small	O
gold	O
discoveries	O
are	O
valuable	O
,	O
with	O
every	O
10	O
,	O
000	O
ounces	O
being	O
worth	O
over	O
$20m	O
in	O
gross	O
terms.	O
We	O
already	O
have	O
some	O
of	O
these	O
and	O
have	O
moved	O
to	O
put	O
them	O
under	O
ML	O
’	O
s	O
,	O
but	O
of	O
course	O
we	O
are	O
focused	O
on	O
finding	O
more	O
meaningful	O
orebodies	O
on	O
our	O
extremely	O
prospective	O
ground.	O
As	O
promised	O
last	O
year	O
we	O

EXPLORATION	O
OVERVIEW	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
(	O
‘	O
LGP	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
some	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
South	O
East	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Goldfields	O
Province	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
project.	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
is	O
wholly	O
owned	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O
The	O
commanding	O
,	O
semi-contiguous	O
,	O
granted	O
land	O
package	O
covers	O
598km2	O
immediately	O
east	O
of	O
and	O
adjoining	O
the	O
world	O
class	O
St	O
Ives	O
Gold	O
camp	O
,	O
operated	O
by	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
Limited	O
(	O
NYSE	O
:	O
GFI	O
)	O
(	O
“	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
immediately	O
south	O
of	O
the	O
high-grade	O
Mt	O
Monger	O
gold	O
centre	O
operated	O
by	O
Silver	O
Lake	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
SLR	O
)	O
.	O

Four	O
gold	O
processing	O
operations	O
are	O
strategically	O
located	O
within	O
50km	O
of	O
the	O
project	O
and	O
provide	O
commercial	O
options	O
for	O
processing	O
any	O
gold	O
discovered.	O
The	O
LGP	O
is	O
referenced	O
in	O
two	O
packages	O
i.e.	O
	O

Eastern	O
Lefroy	O
covering	O
226km2	O
of	O
wholly	O

tenements	O
including	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
,	O
Red	O
Dale	O
,	O
Hang	O
Glider	O
Hill	O
,	O
Havelock	O
,	O
and	O
other	O

along	O
the	O
regional	O
scale	O

Monger	O
fault	O
,	O
and	O
	O

Western	O
Lefroy	O
JV	O
tenements	O
covering	O
372km2	O

the	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
tenements	O
that	O

up	O
the	O

mining	O
operation.	O
These	O
tenements	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
Joint	O
Venture	O
agreement	O
with	O
Gold	O
Fields.	O

can	O

up	O
to	O
a	O
70%	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
Lefroy	O
tenements	O
by	O

up	O
to	O
a	O

of	O
$25million	O
on	O
exploration	O
activities	O
within	O
6	O
years	O
of	O
the	O

date	O
,	O
7June	O
2018.	O
The	O
LGP	O
covers	O
a	O
large	O
belt	O
of	O
Archaean	O
aged	O
rocks	O
that	O
are	O
transected	O
by	O
major	O

(	O

Monger	O
and	O

)	O

by	O
the	O

Survey	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
(	O
‘	O

’	O
)	O
,	O
previous	O
explorers	O
and	O
researchers.	O

Company	O
is	O
the	O
first	O

tenement	O
areas	O
under	O
one	O

search	O
for	O
a	O
new	O
,	O
large	O
gold	O
system.	O

year	O

prospect	O

aircore	O

and	O
Capstan	O

early	O
stage	O

at	O

by	O

)	O

a	O

cover	O
approximately	O
30km	O
of	O

the	O
regional	O

Mt	O

to	O

of	O

Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
has	O
been	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
objectives	O
with	O
shareholder	O
and	O
business	O
objectives	O
by	O
providing	O
a	O
fixed	O
remuneration	O
component	O
and	O
offering	O
long-term	O
incentives	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate.	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
believes	O
the	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
to	O
be	O
appropriate	O
and	O
effective	O
in	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitable	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
to	O
run	O
and	O
manage	O
the	O
Group.	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
,	O
setting	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
for	O
the	O
Managing	O
Director	O
,	O
was	O
developed	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
a	O
base	O
salary	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
factors	O
such	O
as	O
experience	O
)	O
and	O
superannuation.	O
The	O
board	O
will	O
review	O
executive	O
packages	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
considers	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
its	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
and	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
performance	O
,	O
executive	O
performance	O
and	O
comparable	O
information	O
from	O
industry	O
sectors	O
and	O
other	O
listed	O
companies	O
in	O
similar	O
industries.	O
The	O
Board	O
may	O
exercise	O
discretion	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
approving	O
incentives	O
,	O
bonuses	O
and	O
shares	O
under	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Share	O
Plan	O
Trust	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O
The	O
policy	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
for	O
performance	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
long-term	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O
The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
the	O
superannuation	O
guarantee	O
contribution	O
required	O
by	O
the	O
government	O
of	O
Australia	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
9.5%	O
for	O
the	O
2019	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
entitled	O
to	O
receive	O
any	O
other	O
retirement	O
benefits.	O
The	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
at	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
comparable	O
companies	O
for	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O
The	O
Board	O
determines	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
and	O
reviews	O
their	O
remuneration	O
annually	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
practice	O
,	O
duties	O
and	O
accountability.	O
Independent	O
external	O
advice	O
is	O
sought	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
required.	O
To	O
align	O
directors	O
’	O
interests	O
with	O
shareholder	O
interests	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
hold	O
shares	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O
Performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
The	O
Group	O
utilises	O
performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
motivate	O
directors	O
and	O
employees	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Ltd	O
Share	O
Plan	O
which	O
was	O
approved	O
by	O
shareholders	O
on	O
12	O
September	O
2016.	O
Where	O
utilised	O
,	O
shares	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Plan	O
do	O
not	O
vest	O
until	O
certain	O
hurdles	O
have	O
been	O
met.	O
The	O

are	O
based	O
around	O
future	O
events	O
that	O
will	O
advance	O
the	O
Company	O
towards	O
its	O
objectives.	O

of	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O

of	O
